intro: Sacciolepis antsirabensis, commonly known as the Madagascar sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the dry, arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
